DataElement.preferredName: Non-Protocol High Dose Chemotherapy Transplant Administered Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to treatment of cancer using a schedule not listed in the protocol to administer large doses of chemical agents before replacing diseased tissue with healthy cells or DNA.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Non-Protocol High Dose Chemotherapy Transplant Administered
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to treatment of cancer using a schedule not listed in the protocol to administer large doses of chemical agents before replacing diseased tissue with healthy cells or DNA.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: Treatment not specified in a protocol.

A cancer treatment having a treatment dose that is higher than the standard dosage levels recommended on the product labeling for that chemotherapeutic agent. This dose is concurrently toxic and destroys the normal bone marrow stem cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: Healthy skin, bone, or other tissue taken from one part of the body and used to replace diseased or injured tissue removed from another part of the body.:Given.

Concepts.definition: Tissue or organ transplanted from a donor to a recipient.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field related to treatment or therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
